06-02-2025-22:30.content:
In the following table in json format, specified by the tags <t></t> there is a column "text" that contains tweets in japanese, please add another column named 'sentiment' with tags that represent the sentiment expressed by the text, from the following set of labels : {frustration, anger, sadness, compassion, shame, joy, pain, fear, hope, disgust, solitude}. There can be more than one labels per tweet. Return the table in json format, with only the 'id' and 'sentiment' columns, as in the following example : [{'id': '123', 'sentiment': ['anger', 'sadness']}, {'id': '456', 'sentiment': ['hope', 'shame', 'compassion']}]  

table :
06-02-2025-22:30.comment: Provided example to give more indication of expected output format

06-02-2025-22:36.content:
In the following table in json format, specified by the tags <t></t> there is a column "text" that contains tweets in japanese, please add another column named 'sentiment' with tags that represent the sentiment expressed by the text, from the following set of labels : {'frustration', 'anger', 'sadness', 'compassion', 'shame', 'joy', 'pain', 'fear', 'hope', 'disgust', 'solitude'}. If the text of the tweet is neutral and/or simply informative without displaying any specific emotion, simply return an empty list []. There can be more than one labels per tweet. Return the table in json format, with only the 'id' and 'sentiment' columns, as in the following example : [{'id': '123', 'sentiment': ['anger', 'sadness']}, {'id': '456', 'sentiment': ['hope', 'shame', 'compassion']}]  

table :
06-02-2025-22:36.comment: Added information about when there is no label (might need to create a 'neutral' category instead
